data.text: @VictimOfMaths Not sure I'd interpret that as "good news" at all. "Less bad" perhaps, but it's clear that infections must be increasing.
@dobssi (whatever you might think about the rights or wrongs of that direction of travel)

@dobssi Yeah, I find that chap a little odd. I'm not sure I'd have expected the lead of a respected study to start shouting that they were being shut down because of a conspiracy, rather than as part of a wider tailing off of pandemic monitoring by the government...
@VictimOfMaths Yep. Zoe actually thinks it’s 5x…. https://t.co/800shZKJZG

@dobssi It's a bit more complicated than that. Paul has done some adjustments to both the case data (based on historical age-specific case ascertainment rates) and (IIRC) the ZOE figures to get them to align better.
@VictimOfMaths Looks like true prevalence closer to Zoe than UkGov…and by a factor of around 3. https://t.co/QsT6YBAn2A
@TeknowMusic Who are you talking to? If you’re suggesting I’m a ‘minimiser’ then you’re clearly not paying attention.

@VictimOfMaths I am grateful to the many who have reflected the true figures re Covid  despite national episodes of denial. IF funding was available could we wisely return to a GP/Local Auth local model of diagnosis,isolation,contact tracing in the future or do we a lower no of cases first?
